q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.utils

Class PTNArcHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.utils.PTNArcHelper

  • public class PTNArcHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Offers methods for dealing with arc computations, like normalizing their start and end point. It's technically a delegate for Desktop and net controller.
    Author:
    q8388415 - Massimiliano Brero

    • Method Detail

      • normalizeLocation

        public java.awt.Point normalizeLocation(PTNArc arc,
                               java.lang.Boolean normalizeSource)
        Sets start and end points right in the middle of the source and target node. The line then gets an offset, so starting and end point will be right from or at the boundary of the node's icon. If you want to change that, this is the place to change.
        Parameters:
        arc - Type: PTNArc. ArcModel that holds informations about the arc like source and target
        normalizeSource - Boolean Whether the start or ending point of the arc is needed. This we we may only normalize only starting or only ending point.
        Returns:
        Point Calculated Position including offset.

      • getCenteredLocation

        public java.awt.Point getCenteredLocation(PTNINodeDTO node)
        Calculates location right in the middle of the node.
        Parameters:
        node - PTNINodeDTO
        Returns:
        Point Center of Node.

      • addArcListener

        public void addArcListener(ArcView arcView)
        Parameters:
        arcView - ArcView Adds an arc as scale listener.

      • isAlreadyOnDesktop

        public java.lang.Boolean isAlreadyOnDesktop(java.awt.Point start,
                                   java.awt.Point end)
        Check if there's already such an arc with identical start and end points.
        Parameters:
        start - Point
        end - Point
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • showErrorPaneDoubleArc

        public void showErrorPaneDoubleArc()
        If the user tries to draw an arc that this Error window will pop up. It will also show if theres an arc with identical start and and end point.

      • initArcView

        public void initArcView(ArcView arcView,
               PTNNode targetModel,
               NodeView targetView)
        Prepares arc to be shown in view. This method will also activate the target node view if the corresponding model node is activated.
        Parameters:
        arcView - ArcView
        targetModel - PTNNode
        targetView - NodeView

      • generateId

        public java.lang.String generateId()
        Generates a unique id concatenating id prefix and a random number. It also checks id number is already present
        Returns:
        String new id for an arc

      • handleArcSelection

        public void handleArcSelection(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Checks if an arc on the desktop was clicked and updates its selection state.
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent
